description: Erection of a pair of semi-detached houses to the rear of the host dwelling. Demolition of single storey side extension to host dwelling to allow for access to the proposed dwellings. Erection of front and rear dormer roof extensions with installation of 2nos. front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion of the host dwelling.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: SMKCON Name: Borough Wide Smoke Control Order
KEYACH Name: Tolworth Key Area of Change
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

decision_conditions: The proposed development, by means of the new dwellinghouses having double bedrooms that do not meet the minimum space standards, would fail to provide an adequate standard of accommodation for future occupants, and insufficient information, by a lack of section plans, has been submitted to demonstrate whether ceiling heights are sufficient to achieve a suitable level of daylight penetration, ventilation and cooling, and sense of space, contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The proposed development, in terms of the scale, mass, siting and height of the new dwellinghouses, would be visually jarring and overly dominant resulting in unacceptable impacts on the sense of openness that is an important characteristic of the leafy suburban local area, and the proposed front dormer would be an incongruous addition resulting in a  unacceptable deterioration of the appearance of the host property and streetscene, contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012, and guidance in Council's Residential Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document 2013 and Small Sites Design Narrative (2024).

Insufficient information, by lack of an overshadowing assessment, has been submitted to demonstrate the proposed dwellinghouses would not result in unacceptable overbearing enclosure on the rear gardens of no. 16 Woodside Close and the host property at no. 48 Lyndhurst Close and a loss of sunlight beyond the acceptable standards under BRE Guidelines, contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012, and guidance in Council's Residential Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document 2013.

The proposed development, in terms of the site access and off-street car parking layout and design, would fail to support efficient and safe vehicle maneuvering resulting in unacceptable impacts on the function and safety of the local highway network, contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021, Policy DM9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012, and guidance in Council's Sustainable Transport Supplementary Planning Document 2013.

Insufficient information, in the form of a Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, has been submitted to determine if the proposed development would result in unacceptable impacts on the ecology and biodiversity on the site through the extent of vegetation removal proposed, and that it would be exempt from Biodiversity Net Gain, Policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The proposed development, by means of no turning facilities for fire-fighting vehicles and no fire-fighting suppression systems being provided, fails to demonstrate the highest standards of fire safety would be achieved, contrary to Policy D12 of the London Plan 2021 and Requirement B5 of Approved Document B of the Building Regulation 2010.
